text:
Change Java Protocol to use Thread.currentThread().getContextClassLoader() to 
load classes.
creator: brad@kiewel.net
brad@kiewel.net
text:
Created attachment 2454
Updated java files for fix

Your attachment seems to have been corrupted.  It came through as a binary file,
which I can't use.

But, I have modified ClassFinder to use thread.getContextClassLoader(), so that
should fix the problem.
creator: mstover1@apache.org

text:
Created attachment 2456
Updated Java Protocol files to fix class loading problem
creator: brad@kiewel.net

text:
Thanks for updating the ClassFinder.

These are fixes that actually go in the org.apache.jmeter.protocol.java 
packages.  They implement the same fix as found in ClassFinder.
creator: brad@kiewel.net

text:
Marking all bugs RESOLVED before JMeter 1.8's release date as VERIFIED.
Yes, it's pretty poor QA procedure, but there's bugs here lingering since JMeter
1.6, and we need to clean up a little.
creator: jsalvata@atg.com
jsalvata@atg.com
text: Bulk-closing all bugs RESOLVED before JMeter 1.8 release date.
